message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SI 

The paper discusses the use of metrics and peer review in research assessment, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. cs.DL (Digital Libraries) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are likely because they deal with the organization and retrieval of research publications, which are the focus of the analysis. cs.CY (Computers and Society) is also relevant because the paper discusses the impact of research assessment on academic culture and incentives. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) are less likely but still possible because they may involve research assessment and evaluation.
